subject: Gardening
title: The Cottage Garden Aesthetic
description: A quick, practical guide to The Cottage Garden Aesthetic.

hook.text: Cottage gardens look wild and random. They're actually carefully designed to simulate charming abundance.

buildup.text: Originally, cottage gardens were practicalâ€”herbs, vegetables, and flowers crammed into small plots by the poor.

discovery.text: Victorian romantics idealized it. Gertrude Jekyll elevated the style into a design philosophy using color theory.

twist.text: The 'effortless' cottage look needs more upkeep than a formal garden. Self-seeding plants must be edited constantly.

climax.text: Cottage gardens celebrate abundance and informalityâ€”but great ones are meticulously planned to look unplanned.

punchline.text: Cottage gardens look carefree. They're actually high-maintenance.
